name: Clubhotel Riu Karamboa

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We visited the Karamboa for a second time having had such a wonderful holiday there last year. We were not disappointed. The food if possible was even better than last year; I would defy anyone not to find something that appealed to their choice. The service in the main restaurant was excellent. The only downside being that whilst there is a policy for men to wear trousers at the evening meal there were many men (Unfortunately mainly British) who looked as if they had just come off the beach wearing swimming shorts and flip flops. I would urge the management at the Karamboa to ensure that they impose their policy as I for one do not wish to spend my evening meal with guests who cannot make the effort to respect basic standard of recognised dress code.
reviews.title: JUST AS GOOD AS LAST YEAR

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The reception staff were very helpful and attended to any query quickly and efficiently.
reviews.title: OK

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We visited all of the theme restaurants, the best being the Asian. Make sure you book as soon as you can to ensure the dates you need.
reviews.title: Excellent and generous hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Would we recommend this hotel, certainly.
reviews.title: Enjoyable Stay But Some Room For Improvement

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall an OK holiday but the hotel really struggle with flies and insects. I caught an ear infection during my stay and the doctor revealed that every other person he sees has had the same issue and he believes it stems from the cleanliness of the pool. Thomson also had a log of everyone holidaying with ear infections and it was extensive. We tried to not let it ruin the holiday but 6 days out of 14 I was out of action in the room with the most horrendous and agonising ear pain. The entertainment was excellent and a real credit to the hotel as well as the food choice and location but believe the cleanliness standards and service need to be a lot better to warrant a 4 star review.
reviews.title: All rounded review, good and not so good

reviews.text: Fantastic!! Great hotel. Staff friendly. Great choice of food and drinks.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Beach beautiful to look at but dangerous for bathing in December anyway.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.title: Would Visit again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: Worth taking a look around the island. People laid back and friendly.
reviews.title: Flawless

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for one week to escape the snow at home, and were lucky to make it on time as Brussels Airport had to close down only minutes after our departure.
reviews.title: Just What the Doctor Ordered.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: This was our second visit to Cape Verde (went to Sal last year) and we booked as we knew what we were getting for our money. Its certainly no where near 5* but I don't think the price we paid would reflect that anyway.
reviews.title: Not 5* but still good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Flight was ok, leg room really wasn't that bad for a charter flight, in flight meal was average and as other people mention, there is no entertainment, I saw a lot of iPads!
reviews.title: Amazeballs!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Transfer really was less than 5 mins and hotel check in was quick and efficient.
reviews.title: Amazing holiday

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We had a ground floor room (no.0098) very well located but I was very grateful I packed my ear plugs - you can hear everything as the room is near the walk-through area to other floors and other buildings. I wouldn't have slept at all well if I didn't have them. Having said that, I also found the beds really hard and not that comfortable. The TV in the room does not favour UK visitors so not worth watching. Bathroom is fine but lack of a door could be an issue for some people (there is a door on the toilet!).
reviews.title: Holiday June 2013

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We went there to completely relax - and laid by the pool or on the beach all week. It can get busy and noisy especially when the entertainment team get going, but its not too disturbing, the beach however is lovely and quiet and there are plenty of sunbeds at whatever time of the day. The sea can be a bit rough - I think we were quite lucky while we were there and were able to go in the sea everyday, there was a yellow flag all week.
reviews.title: Nice hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: OMG!! We are well travelled but have never had the pleasure of staying in a Riu before. Really, truthfully, totally faultless. the place was spotless, the people fantastic and the food was out of this world!!!!! I mean, the selection, thpresentation etc - you saw everything cooked in front of you and everything was so well protected and refrigarated where required etc. The weather was pretty bliss, but even the couple of overcast days were still pleasurable in and around the hotel. I took my husband as a suprise for his 40th and we only stayed for a week - we cannot wait to reurn next year with our kids who will be 7 & 3, and the mother in law. We may try Sal, just for comparison, but I heard people talking about there in the same vein as this hotel - just Brilliant.
reviews.title: Totally Amazing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Was worried before we went as we had read some pretty poor reviews - mostly regarding the flight. I have to agree that the flight was fairly cramped and the staff weren't the best organised crew but for 2 weeks "chill out" time it was bearable.
reviews.title: Total Chill Out

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The airport is quaint, hotel fab, staff very attentive, superb service etc. etc.
reviews.title: Very Chilled out week

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: There is nothing to do ! I read 7 books in 2 weeks. We caught lots of sharks and moray eels on the beach and went for lots of long walks along the fabulous beach but apart from that we just made the most of our time there.
reviews.title: A smokers paradise - Hell for non-smokers

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only downside for us was that the sea is very unkind at times, we had 1 green flag in 2 weeks and the waves can be anything up to 15 feet high when they come crashing in - beware the strong undercurrent. My husband broke his leg whilst standing in the sea - his foot sank into the lovely soft sand and a wave wiped him out ! There is only a clinic on the island and it was 3 days before we came home so he hobbled about and then ended up in plaster for 7 weeks afterwards. The hotel staff and tour reps were fab and couldn't do enough to make his pain bearable - shame our NHS don't share the same empathy talents here !
reviews.title: Great hotel, but a corporate monster!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you really need a week or two's re coup, with a brilliant huge and mainly deserted beach, excellent pool with lots of sun beds- this is the resort for you.
reviews.title: PERFECT FOR LOW KEY RELAXATION- ASK FOR THE SPECIAL DRINKS...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: If you want a holiday where there is lots to see and do around the hotel- then this maybe isn't for you.
reviews.title: Wrestful and enjoyable experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our second Riu holiday after going to Mambo in Dominican Republic, and whilst it would be unfair in many ways to compare the two- we preferred Dominican Republic by a whisker.
reviews.title: excellent holiday

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: However, we felt that the food in Karamboa was excellent, as were the drinks (apart from the wine which is pretty awful- do take a nice bottle with you as the shop prices are steep to say the least) one tip is to ask for some of the named brands that they do stock but don't promote. For instance they have Gordon's gin, Bicardi, Vat 69 Scotch Whisky and a few others- if you name them, they put them in the drinks, if not, you get the local stuff which is .....ok. Try the Grogue, it a local drink- i'm not saying it's nice but if it's good enough for pirates...
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel, staff fantastic, great for families with teenagers, entertainments team were brilliant
fantastic hotel and staff
reviews.text: The staff are very efficient and on the whole very polite and friendly. Prior to my introduction to the Riu franchise I would have turned my nose up at all inclusive holidays, but if you're wanting a stress free, dependable and relaxing holiday- you would be hard pressed to find better.

reviews.title: very relaxing place
reviews.text: our first visit to cape verde.

reviews.title: Fantastic honeymoon
reviews.text: RECEPTION- very smooth check in, very helpful, very friendly.

reviews.title: Great holiday! 5* with some room for improvement.
reviews.text: ROOM- very clean and spacious, nice size balcony with a little pull out clothes drier, toiletries are provided, hairdryer is ok but i would recommend taking your own really.room was cleaned daily to high standard.

reviews.title: Slightly disappointed
reviews.text: POOL-we only used the pool twice(only because we liked the beach), loved the swim up bar, it also has 2 jacuzzis, was cleaned early morning daily, probably could do with some maintainance, some tiles needed replacing.always plenty of sun loungers available.

reviews.title: relaxing by the beach
reviews.text: BEACH- very clean, unspolit, you can walk to the next hotel along with no problem (take some water and wear suncream).

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The Best holiday to date, short coach ride to hotel, you can see the Riu karamboa from the airport, Hotel check in was good, friendly & helpful as were all the staff, nothing was too much trouble. Large rooms, plenty of drawer/hanging space, were spotless, large comfy beds,aircon was fine once we found how to turn it up/down.Food was brilliant, plenty of choice plus CV, Asian & indian themed restaurantes to choose from all excellent. Large swimming pools, daily activities, always something going on. plenty of beds in & out of the water & again plenty of beds on the beach. need to take lots of suncream etc as mostly expensive to buy there, Always windy, another reason for suncream, sea can be a bit rough so you need to be a fairly good swimmer, lifeguards on duty though.. Very good beach bar, well stocked & very friendly staff.Plenty to do, it's your choice. We did Whale watching (booked from GB) excellent, Half day island tour, very good guide, interesting. The boys went deep sea fishing & fished from the beach on a few occasions caught a few inc. small hammerhead. just walking along the beach you spot the turtles feeding by the rocks.Not a great deal to see in Sal Rei,but worth a trip. Loved the evening entertainment, very professional & again lovely people Children were entertained in the kids club
reviews.title: Riu Karamboa, Boa Vista, Cape Verde Islands

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: The holiday we had in the hotel Rui Karamboa Boa Vista was excellent, the food was good and the position of the Hotel was fine,and I was amazed how clean everything was even the toilets going onto the beach was like the toilets you dreamed of. The hotel staff who put on the entertainment were very good ,but one word of advice do not bother to book a taxi from the air port to the hotel because it is only 2minutes away, I would have no hesitation in returning to this hotel.
reviews.title: DELUX

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: My parents took us to this hotel for two weeks to celebrate their anniversary. Accommodation, food, staff, facilities all very good. The beach is one of the most stunning I've seen, a shame you can't swim comfortably in it though. Entertainment was good and kept you occupied all day. The connection to the airport is laughably short, (you can see the hotel from the runway). Kids were well looked after and the pool was perfect for them (5 and 8). Would recommend for people who want a no - worries HOT holiday.
reviews.title: Two weeks all inclusive

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Downsides - Nothing else there unless you pay a lot for excursions.
reviews.title: Nice Holiday

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Generally a great, very easy holiday.
reviews.title: Cape Verde Holiday June 2013

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This may be some people's idea of paradise but to me it was an obscene drain on the resources of Cape Verde. We had to stay here as our flight back to the UK was cancelled due to the bad weather and this is where the airline put us up.
reviews.title: Hell in paradise at this hideous monstrosity

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On arrival to Boa Vista we had seen this huge monstrosity on the landscape and were glad we weren’t staying there. To be fair they have tried to blend the building into the landscape and it looks like a huge elaborate sandcastle. The place was 5* but it was a sterile environment with a list of do’s and don'ts everywhere including don't hang anything over any balconies or verandas as it would ruin the aesthetics of the place, check back in the towel card for ‘verification’ of the correct usage of towels – whatever that means.
reviews.title: Nice resort, not brilliant though

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Not everything is free though - another aspect which I found despicable was €3.50 to use the Internet for 15 minutes whether you were using their laptops or your own laptop / iPhone - all I wanted to check was when our flight would finally be leaving as I was desperate to get out of the place.
reviews.title: The Monster

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: The room itself looked every part what you'd expect in a five * hotel with a safe, fridge, place to hang your clothes, TV including loads of channels - so if you need to get a bit of peace & quiet, just go to your room - no need to venture out. The room was open plan including shower / bathroom which can be a pain due to the noise / light should one of you still be sleeping when the other gets up to take a shower, which incidentally, you can hear the other rooms doing the same as the walls are so thin.
reviews.title: Totally Amazing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I’ve read other reviews and one thing that has been mentioned were the mosquito’s. This and Decameron - the other 'all inclusive' we had the misfortune to stay in because of our delayed flight - were the only places in our whole stay in Cape Verde where we had problems with mosquito's and I got bitten quite badly at both of them.
reviews.title: Absolutely fabulous

aka: Clubhotel Riu Karamboa Hotel Boa Vista
description: Situated on the island Boavista in the Cape Verde Islands. 2-storey main building and 3-storey annexes. Situated on the beachfront. Complimentary sun loungers and parasols on the beach. 7 km to Sal Rei. 1,5 km from the airport. Credit cards accepted: Visa
